short, this exchange begins a long series of further
bindings between still more specialized molecular machinery, and scientists
now understand a great deal about the system of gateways, pumps, ion chan-
nels, critical concentrations, and attenuated signals that result in a current to
finally be transmitted down the optic nerve to the brain, interpreted as vision.
Biochemists also understand the many chemical reactions involved in restor-
ing all these changed or depleted parts to make a new cyc
